snippet: Even though the percentage has dropped by more than half, more than a million teenagers still consume alcohol before getting behind the wheel.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says 10.3 percent of high school students 16 and older reported drinking and driving in a 2012 survey, compared with 22.3 percent in 1991; says decline is partly due to tougher laws against driving under the influence of alcohol.
lead_paragraph: Even though the percentage has dropped by more than half, more than a million teenagers still consume alcohol before getting behind the wheel.

headline.seo: Fewer Teenagers Are Drinking and Driving, C.D.C. Says
headline.main: Fewer Teenagers Are Driving After Drinking, Study Shows
headline.print_headline: Fewer Teenagers Are Driving After Drinking, Study Shows

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
